name: BTLELib
tagline: iOS library for connecting with, and sending data to, another device via Bluetooth LE.
body: BTLELib ======= iOS library for connecting with and sending data to another device via Bluetooth LE. ##### Features: * Simplified, abstracted API to CoreBluetooth * [BTLEPeripheral](https://github.com/KeithErmel/BTLELib/blob/master/BTLELib/BTLELib/Source/Bluetooth/BTLEPeripheral.h) - data provider * [BTLECentral](https://github.com/KeithErmel/BTLELib/blob/master/BTLELib/BTLELib/Source/Bluetooth/BTLECentral.h) - consumer of data provided by peripheral * Send & Receive Data * [BTLEDataSender](https://github.com/KeithErmel/BTLELib/blob/master/BTLELib/BTLELib/Source/Bluetooth/BTLEDataSender.h) * [BTLEReceiver](https://github.com/KeithErmel/BTLELib/blob/master/BTLELib/BTLELib/Source/Bluetooth/BTLEDataReceiver.h) * Can send either a packet (<= 20 bytes) or package of data * Packaged data is parceled into 20 byte chunks * Queued up & sent in order to receiver via GCD * Provides progress updates to delegates (both sender & receiver) * Ideal for adding BTLE support to your apps * Easily turn any device that provides BTLE into a peripheral or central * Note that this is not yet a full-featured BTLE library: * The initial release focuses on seamless pairing & data transfer between devices * Future additions will provide generalized support for: * Services * Read / write characteristics * etc. ##### Using * Clone repo * Drag & drop BTLELib.xcodeproj into your workspace * Follow [Apple's documentation](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/technotes/iOSStaticLibraries/Articles/configuration.html) on how to use static libraries in iOS The library uses ARC. It has been developed using Xcode 5 & tested against iOS 7.x. ##### Documentation [Latest HTML documentation](http://keithermel.github.io/BTLELib/docs/index.html) The Xcode project includes a `Documentation` target which can be used to generate documentation for the API. It requires the use of [appledoc](http://gentlebytes.com/appledoc/). Once you've built the documentation it will be available through Xcode's Documentation window. ##### Examples * The [BTLELibExample](https://github.com/KeithErmel/BTLELib/tree/master/Examples/BTLELibExample) sends a bit over 10K of data to a receiver * Requires two devices running the example app * One serves as sender, the other as receiver; user selectable * Provides progress updates to UI via progress bar on both the sending & receiving devices
